svg.title: Players want to define their own virtual worlds, but they can't because making their own virtual worlds is hard.
svg.desc:
#direction: right #title: Players want to define their own virtual worlds, but they can't because making their own virtual worlds is hard. #fontSize: 8 #spacing: 12 #padding: 3
[V-Sekai| Players want to define the virtual worlds. | V-Sekai https://v-sekai.org/ | Players can't make their own virtual worlds because it is hard. | 📆 Planned - 📝 First implementation - 🔧 QA required]
[Tasks] - [<table> Collaborate and create| 📆 Estimate | ?W || Earliest Start Time | Latest Start Time|| Earliest Finish Time| Latest Finish Time] [Collaborate and create] -> [Godot world live creation| 📆] [Collaborate and create] -> [Place prexisting blocks with blockmeshing| 📆 ] [<table> Collaborate and create| 📆 ]->[<table> Create Godot world creation tools | 📆 | 📆 Place scenes. | 📆 Construct layers collaboratively. | 📆 Painting] [<table> Collaborate and create| 📆 ]->[<table> Create Godot world creation tools | 📆 | 📆 3D models with CASSIE | 📆 In-editor model with PLY | 📆 Painting with MaterialX ] [V-Sekai]->[<table> Import and upload worlds | 📝 | 📝 Godot world offline upload | 📆 Engine usability] [<table> Import and upload worlds| 📝 ]->[<table> 📆 Good graphics | 📆 Good lighting | 📆 VFX (Particles, shaders, Sky)] [<table> Import and upload worlds| 📝 ]->[<table> 📝 World importer | 📝 Physically based material pipeline] [V-Sekai]->[<table> Create avatars| 📝 | 📝 Godot avatar offline upload | 📆 Advanced avatar (shader, IK, animations)] [<table> Create avatars| 📝]->[<table> 📝 Importer| 📆 Imported physics | 📆 Skeleton modifications] [<table> Create avatars| 📝]->[📝 Motion Dances] [V-Sekai]->[<table> Become avatars| 📆 | 📆 Vocal communicate | 📆 Motion communicate | 📆 Dance] [<table> Become avatars| 📆]->[<table> 📝 Networking | 📆 Godot speech comms system | 📆 Virtual reality 6 degree of freedom tracking] [<table> Become avatars| 📆]->[<table> 📆 Following | 📆 Double-sided friending. | 📆 Discover new friends.] [<table> Become avatars| 📆]->[<table> 📝 Player Controller | 📆 Locomotion (flat) | 📆 Virtual reality motion movement] [V-Sekai]->[<table> Interactions | 📆 | 📆 Wasgo Scripting | 📆 In-game menus | 📆 Video player] [<table> Interactions| 📆]->[<table> 📝 Standard interactions system (entities) | 📆 Vehicles | 📆Pickups | 📆 Buttons] [<table> Interactions| 📆]->[<table> 📆 Avatar switch | 📆 World portals | 📆 Server switch] [<table> Interactions| 📆]->[<table> 📆 Player interactions | 📆 Camera | 📆 Bow and arrow | 📆 Mirror] [V-Sekai]->[<table> Uro Infrastructure| 📆 | 📝 Identity | 📆 Federation list | 🔧 Shard list | 📆 Delegated Identity] [<table> Uro Infrastructure| 📆 ]->[<table> 📆 Content | 📝 Inventory of stored resources | 📆 Refuse to attest content because scripting is untrusted] [<table> Uro Infrastructure| 📆]->[<table> 📆 Deployment kit | 📝 Content hosting]
[Tasks] - [<table> Upgrade PLY to Godot Engine| Estimate | 1W || Earliest Start Time | Latest Start Time|| Earliest Finish Time| Latest Finish Time]
[Tasks] - [<table> Launch uro using Elixir Desktop| Estimate | 1W || Earliest Start Time | Latest Start Time|| Earliest Finish Time| Latest Finish Time]
[Tasks] - [<table> Make TrueNas Scale run V-Sekai mirror | Estimate | 1W || Earliest Start Time | Latest Start Time|| Earliest Finish Time| Latest Finish Time]
// * https://pmstudycircle.com/critical-path-method-cpm-in-project-management/ // * Earliest Start Time or Early Start (ES): This is the earliest time an activity can be started in your project. // * Latest Start Time or Late Start (LS): This is the latest time that an activity can be started on your project. If you start the activity beyond this time, it will affect your critical path. // * Earliest Finish Time or Early Finish (EF): This is the earliest time an activity is completed in your project. // * Latest Finish Time of Late Finish (LF): This is the latest time you can complete the activity on your project. If your activity crosses this time, your project will be delayed.

[<table> Become avatars | 📆 || How do we animate the character? VRM1 rig || How do we retarget to the VRM1 rig? Open question || How do we mocapture the face rig? Support mapping every single possible standard rig? || How do we make the face rig fast? Blend shape baking to skeletals || How do we create the standard animation set? Want to be better than the status quo of mixamo animation sets || How do we interact with objects? Pickup animation is stored on prop || How do we have more diverse characters? Marketplace? Proceduralism? Character generators? || How we turn our voice to facial rig keyframes? Open problem ]
// [V-Sekai] - [<table> MVP Canvas] // [<table> MVP Canvas] - [Source | https://martinfowler.com/articles/lean-inception/build-mvp-canvas.html ] // // [<table> MVP Canvas| Personas & Platforms| MVP Vision | Outcome Statement|| // Journeys | Features | Metrics for business hypothesis validation || // | Cost & Schedule | || // ]
[V-Sekai] - [Last changed datetime|2022-01-31T19:09+00:00]
svg.text: How do we animate the character? VRM1 rig
How do we retarget to the VRM1 rig? Open question
How do we mocapture the face rig? Support mapping every single possible standard rig?
How do we make the face rig fast? Blend shape baking to skeletals
How do we create the standard animation set? Want to be better than the status quo of mixamo animation sets
How do we interact with objects? Pickup animation is stored on prop
How do we have more diverse characters? Marketplace? Proceduralism? Character generators?
How we turn our voice to facial rig keyframes? Open problem

svg.text: Players want to define the virtual worlds.
Players can't make their own virtual worlds because it is hard.
📆 Virtual reality 6 degree of freedom tracking
📆 Refuse to attest content because scripting is untrusted
Combine two clusters of enet and webrtc
casual or new visitors to the ecosystem
New users interested in becoming creators
The people who create things such as worlds or characters on platforms
People who create scripts, often users and environemnts.
People who create characters and avatars.
Creators of characters and outfits which fit multiple characters
Creators of items, assets and props
Developers within the ecosystem of tools
Tool that helps the creators get their job done.
Any person providing a service for the metaverse. (can be free or paid)
